column5: I'm going to try my hand a building some custom rods for myself. I will build rods for the nephews and neices at first, then for myself and some buddies when I get the hang of it. Speil I will probably be e-mailing you with some questions if it's okay with you.
Pushing snow around...  AND  Playing with the kid's mother...
When you are finished you might take a run at sumpin' like this...    http://www.ktuu.com/news/ktuu-radio-flyer-car-092910,0,1784245.story
I put an offer on a condo so if I'm lucky I'll be doing some major renovating.  That rebuilt boat motor looks sharp
That is beautiful Norm, and the couple who built it/enjoying it together will never be unhappy. Just great, hadn't seen that one, thanks.

Your the best bro, brand new 460 chrome valve covers....ummmmm cant wait, call me if your driving by the 401 Ill meet up with you, maybe do lunch on me? and better bring a bunch of those spinners, Amy said he's wants some too...

I love seeing what folks do, other than fishing, in their spare time; and there are some excellent examples shown!  I've got a few hobbies that I've picked up over the years: wine and beer making (that snowballed into me building my own still... 192 proof rum is scary stuff.) guitar and bass playing with my band, airbrushing, custom knife making... This winter I've got a couple of airbrush jobs lined up, and a few knives that I'm wanting to build. Add to that, cleaning up the boat I bought this year, and a few jobs around the house, and I think I'm going to have a busy winter. Here's some examples of some of the things I've done:   Custom computer case for a hard core Star Wars fan.   Airbrushed goalie mask for the Toronto Rock Lacrosse team.   Harley horn cover.   Viking Seax re-creation with a Dragon blade etching. Approx 24" long and razor sharp.   A little utility knife with African Blackwood scales and a little file work under the thumb for grip.   A delicate little Bird and Trout knife.   A neck knife for a fly fisherman. Had a one hand, rare earth magnet sheath.   A big Camp knife with a bear etching. Bloodwood scales.   My first filet knife with Cedar and Maple scales.  Thanks for looking, and let's see some more passtimes!
Now that's some interesting stuff!!!  ..now about that still....
back off Wayne, I was going to ask if he's coming to the BOQ G2G and if so what site he's at...
I do love my still... Well, it's mothballed now, but it was fun while it lasted... Maybe I'll see what I can do over the winter with that too....
Eating the fish I'll be catching  Beyond that, working on more harnesses and casting lead. MAybe a little maintenance work on my buddy's greenhouse in anticipation of spring.
well im canadian so i'll be drinking beer and some C.C, watching hockey and lacrosse until it warms up - hibernation? haha might get out ice fishing 2-3 times...
I'll be playing with my band in hopes of having three 45 minutes sets ready to go early in the new year... hoping to play to drunken fools once a month! HH
Those are some really nice baits Roy     I'll probably make a few myself!!  Joey

I;m sure my wife will be on me with the many projects that need to be done around our home.  I always sight money as the major obstacle to these projects.  Will do a little ice fishing and probably watch a lot of hockey, maybe play a little indoor soccer.  Hoping to go on Paternity leave in February so I guess my main thing will be watching my daughter all day.
Between icefishing,hockey and skiing, there is no spare time but it's all good! Of course there is time in the evenings to make baits for next season but that won't start till this one is done.

I'll be putting out a couple of hundred muskie baits. I have about 150 on the go. Some are at the router stage, others at the lathe, some at wood sealant, a few at white coat, none at water test right now..some at first airbrush stage....lots of lips to cut.  Here's what's hanging in there as we speak.    What are you all doing?

Wow those Muskie lures sure do look nice! Id be interested in one or 2 if your selling them later. Myself I plan on watchin alot of Leafs hockey and making homemade spinner baits. I was considering getting some jig head casts from luremaking.com We shall see. Its going to be a long hard winter im thinking. Lots of snow
......having #2. Now is the build-up and around feb 09 is the excitement ! Also looking for a new house.

tb4me, you musta read my mind.I downloaded the catalogue from luremaking and thought i'd give it a try making some spinnerbaits myself.Looks like fun. also renovating the batroom, and watching WFN with the wife,to keep her stoked till next spring
I'll be sledding, building a few new rods and tying up a pile of pike flies for my Attawapiskat trip next May.
Three old outboards to redo. 1958 18 Johnson. 1958 7.5 Johnson 1955 7.5 Evinrude I hope they turn out as well as the 10 I did last winter.

Very nice me brudder.Love the 3rd from the left.  Bernie. tisk tisk tisk.Oily rags in a open can. Nice job on the 10.  Who the hell knows what I,ll be doing. Sitting in a tree til the end of dec,then some rabbits.Thats if work permits.

Great looking baits Roy I will have to talk to you about a order I see some there that might just do the trick here on LSC.  I will be building alot of Inline Flashabou musky baits that I just started to take to market this summer I have a banner coming to the site when TJ gets back from hunting.  here are a couple that I have done  some packaged ready to hit the stores for the first time early this summer
Nice looking baits Mike.How did you come up with the name? LOL
I'll be working mostly...  Trip to Los Angeles in December.  Probably working on some carving and other projects on the honey do list...
My wife complains that i never get anything done around the house...Maybe thats cause she doesnt have a "Honey do list"
It's to early to tell but I may build a few things.  Another toy box, full wall entertainment unit, frame the basement... duno yet...  it's all a matter of time and money so...
Now how are you going to water test them when the lake is frozen?

Roy... how do you get the hooks to screw into that shiney brown one??  This fall/winter, other than ice fishing, I'm going for a stress test to make sure I'm the odd ball in my family with a good heart!  Then I have a couple sets of amphibs floats to build and an airplane to refurbish. Possibly a wreck to repair as well, if I ever get the quote into the adjuster.
A number of us here in Niagara fish for trout all winter long. Those days that are unfishable, are when we tie our streamers and roe bags.
I am currently working on building boxes, skidpales and a snorkel for the ATV.  I will be doing a ton of ice fishing this winter as well as shedding another 40 - 50 lbs

Nice looking lures Bud. I'm going the start tying some flies, the wife is ready to give me leasons.(she's better then myself) and  be sitin back sipping on a few and watching the Leafs and dreaming of Bass Opener. Good Fishin
Bugging Roy for Muskie lures.
If the weather is to grumbly for ice fishing, then maybe I'll make a coffee table or two.
besdies working? and ice fishing?  sleeping,eating, and planning on my next stradegy for spring and summer bass/pike/lake trout/wall eye fishing

I am not sure what the winter project is this year. It will most likely be mechanical in nature and something to do with metal but as to what type I haven't decided if it will be a motorcycle or a boat? Their will also be a few new lures built and other small projects around the house.   Art

FIRST OFF! ROY AND MIKE  I'll be rebuilding a couple ford 460 big blocks one around 450hp for my jet boat other one around 650hp for my jetboat~ Just picked up a shop size parts washer need to get a coulple cans of safety clean now,,, Oh and reno's, painting, flooring maybe a couple windows..etc. bla bla bla.
I'll be ice fishing for sure   but when I'm not.... will most likely have a go at woodworking.... just like this little piece    Leechman
I think I have a couple things that will help you with the fishing touch on that re build and they are shinny
Some very nice lures there Roy! Any fish they take would prolly pull me into lake. I'll be sharpening my carving knives and think of something to carve to keep me busy for a while.
